intro: Buforrestia imperforata, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to East Africa. It is characterized by its compact rosette of velvety, waxy leaves and produces showy, tubular flowers in shades of purple, pink, and white. The plant is a member of the Gesneriaceae family and is well adapted to humid, shaded environments. Its flowers are typically borne on long, slender stems and are pollinated by insects such as bees and butterflies. Buforrestia imperforata is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and ease of care.
